live.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: if you live in a place, you have your home there
live.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: A rather odd family came to live next door to us.
As soon as I saw the place, I knew I didn’t want to live there.
We’re still looking for somewhere to live.
They’ve finally found a place to live.
Most seventeen-year-olds still live at home (=live with their parents).
The house has 3,600 square feet of living space (=the areas of a house you live in).
I ran away from home and lived rough for nine months.
They lived in Holland for ten years.
He lives just across the street from me.
We live only a few miles from the coast.
My grandmother came to live with us when I was ten.
live.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: a plant or animal that lives in a particular place grows there or has its home there
live.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: These particular birds live on only one island in the Pacific.
live.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: if you live at a particular time, you are alive then
live.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: He’s probably the best journalist who ever lived.
the best/greatest etc that/who ever lived
He lived in the eighteenth century.
She lived at a time when women were not expected to work.
Gladstone lived during a period of great social change.
live.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: to be alive or be able to stay alive
live.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: He is extremely ill and not expected to live.
The baby only lived a few hours.
People on average are living much longer than before.
I’ll never forget this for as long as I live.
He did not live to see (=live long enough to see) the realization of his dream.
live to (be) 80/90 etc/live to the age of 80/90 etc
She lived to the age of 79.
live to (be) 80/90 etc/live to the age of 80/90 etc
He knows he’s only got a few months to live.
have two weeks/six months etc to live
live.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: to have a particular type of life, or live in a particular way
live.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: They earn enough money to live well (=have plenty of food, clothes etc).
I just want to live my life in my own way.
He’s not well enough to live a normal life.
He had chosen to live the life of a monk.
She’s now in Hollywood living a life of luxury.
We struggle on, living from day to day (=trying to find enough money each day to buy food etc).
He was tired of living out of a suitcase (=spending a lot of time travelling).
The people in this country just want to live in peace.
live in peace/poverty etc
People should not live in fear of crime.
live in peace/poverty etc
We live in hope that a cure will be found.
live in peace/poverty etc
The two communities live peacefully alongside each other.
live peacefully/quietly/happily etc
She thought that she would get married and live happily ever after (=like in a children’s story).
live peacefully/quietly/happily etc
Some people like to live dangerously.
live peacefully/quietly/happily etc
Most elderly people prefer to live independently if they can.
live peacefully/quietly/happily etc
She lives a very busy life.
live a quiet/active/healthy etc life
I have always tried to live by my faith  (=according to my religion).
live by
live.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: the way that someone lives is the way that they earn money to buy food etc
live.translation[0].definitions[5].examp: Fishing is the way their families have lived for generations.
They live by hunting and killing deer.
live.translation[0].definitions[6].examp: She wanted to get out and live a little.
We’re beginning to live at last!
live.translation[0].definitions[7].defin: to imagine that things are happening to you
live.translation[0].definitions[7].examp: You must stop living in the past (=imagining that things from the past are still happening).
He lives in a fantasy world.
She lived through her children’s lives.
live.translation[0].definitions[8].defin: the place where something lives is the place where it is kept
live.translation[0].definitions[8].examp: Those big dishes live in the cupboard next to the fridge.
live.translation[0].definitions[9].defin: if an idea lives, it continues to exist and influence people
live.translation[0].definitions[9].examp: That day will always live in my memory.
live.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: live
to have your home somewhere
He lives with his parents.
Where do you live?
Do you like living in Tokyo?
Jo lives next to a busy road.
Judy lives in that nice house on the corner.
How do you like living in the city again after so many years away from it?
In 1905 Russell was living at 4 Ralston Street.
be from/come from
use this when talking about the country, city, or area where you usually live
My name’s Sharon and I’m from Harlow.
The man is believed to be from somewhere in the north of England.
‘Where are you from?’ ‘I’m from Japan.’
The winner came from Australia.
inhabit
if a group of people or animals inhabit an area, they live there – used especially in written descriptions
The island is mainly inhabited by sheep.
Some tribes still inhabit the more remote mountains and jungles of the country.
reside
to live in a particular country, city etc
She now resides in the US.
Miss Badu grew up in Dallas but now resides in Brooklyn.
At that time there were many American writers residing in Paris.
Miss Tonelli, how exactly did you come to reside at your current address?
The government bureau has prepared a booklet for US citizens residing abroad.
grow up
to live somewhere when you are a child or teenager
This is the neighborhood where my father grew up.
I grew up on a farm in South Africa.
live.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Protesters want to stop the export of live sheep and cattle.
the number of live births per 1,000 population
We were so excited to see real live elephants.
live.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: a live television or radio programme is seen or heard on television or radio at the same time as it is actually happening
live.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: There will be live TV coverage of tonight’s big match.
live.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: a live performance is one in which the entertainer performs for people who are watching, rather than for a film, record etc
live.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: A lot of the bars have live music.
The band will be giving a live concert performance next week.
We’ll be playing you a track from his new live album (=album that was recorded from a live performance).
It’s always different when you perform in front of a live audience (=an audience watching a live performance).
live.translation[1].definitions[3].defin: a wire or piece of equipment that is live has electricity flowing through it
live.translation[1].definitions[3].examp: Be careful – those wires are live.
live.translation[1].definitions[4].defin: a live bomb still has the power to explode because it has not been used
live.translation[1].definitions[4].examp: They came across a field of live, unexploded mines.
live.translation[1].definitions[5].defin: live bullets are real ones that are made of metal and can kill people
live.translation[1].definitions[5].examp: Troops fired live ammunition to disperse the crowd.
live.translation[1].definitions[6].defin: a live subject or problem is one that still interests or worries people
live.translation[1].definitions[6].examp: Drink-driving is still very much a live issue.
live.translation[1].definitions[7].defin: live yoghurt contains bacteria that are still alive
live.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: if something is broadcast live, it is broadcast on television or radio as it is actually happening
live.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: The ceremony will be broadcast live on television.
The match will be shown live by the BBC.
live.translation[2].definitions[1].defin: if people perform live, they perform in front of people who have come to watch, rather than for a film, record etc
live.translation[2].definitions[1].examp: I love their music, but I’ve never seen them perform live.
The band is playing live in Birmingham tonight.
Their latest CD was recorded live (=recorded at a live performance) in New York.
